page.title: 17FAUNA OF HARNHILL MANOR FARM
page.content: (Continued from page 16) REPTILES AND AMPHIBIANS Grass snakes, toads, frogs, crested and smooth newts are found in most years; frogs however are becoming very rare indeed. FISH The ponds and brook support Brown and Rainbow Trout. Milleni Thumbs and Crayfish found in the brook. INSECTS 18 species of butterfly have been recorded; of special interest are :_ Clouded Yellows,1983,found in good numbers on flowering Lucerne. Common Blues, established colonies. Large and small Skippers, Marbled Whites. Occasionals: Holly Blue 1976 1984; Small Blue 1976. White Lesser Hairstreaks were common until the onset of Dutch Elm Disease, they were then absent till last year when 1 seen
